page.title: 04Environmental Data
page.content: The area under consideration is a plateau which lies between the river Ithon and Gilwern Hill(439 metres).The generous amount of rainfall 40-45 inches p.a. runs rapidly off the hills via various streams the most important of which cuts the Ithon between Howey and Disserth.Clay makes for poor soil. To the east of Howey and adjacent to Llandrindod lake,there are several relict areas of deciduous woodland. The broadleaf woodland is important. Its avifauna are representative of Welsh oakwood birds. In addition to their indigenous population of avifauna,the pools and river Ithon are of regional significance for their dragonflies.Land improvement schemes (drainage and reseeding) have affected old meadows and damp grassland with concomitant effects on the flora and fauna of certain areas.
